media:group.media:title: Android Studio support for VectorDrawable
media:group.media:description:
Tenghui Zhu introduces new tool supports for VectorDrawable in Android Studio 1.4.
In Android Studio 1.4, developers can create VectorDrawable assets either from the Material library or converted from SVG files. Moreover, for backward compatibility, all the VectorDrawable assets will be converted into PNG files at build time automatically.
More information about the http://tools.android.com/recent
For more Android video content, subscribe to the Android Developers channel here: http://goo.gl/GEh1ds

entry.title: Android Marshmallow 6.0, The Nexus 5X, and Nexus 6P

media:group.media:title: Android Marshmallow 6.0, The Nexus 5X, and Nexus 6P
media:group.media:description:
A summary of the new Nexus 5X and Nexus 6P along with some of the most significant developer features in the latest Android release, the important APIs and how to test them.
All the videos mentioned are also available in the Android Marshmallow Playlist https://www.remote.podcast.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLWz5rJ2EKKc9VBBpeGykiTh8HQ1fSBnk-
For more Android video content, subscribe to the Android Developers channel here: http://goo.gl/GEh1ds
#marshmallow #nexus

media:group.media:title: Android Marshmallow 6.0: App Links
media:group.media:description:
App Links is a new feature of Android Marshmallow that brings a faster way of opening website links for domains that you own. Learn from Wojtek Kaliciński how to verify ownership of your site and get rid of the disambiguation dialog for users who install your app.
Read more about App Links here: https://developer.android.com/preview/features/app-linking.html
For more Android video content, subscribe to the Android Developers channel here: http://goo.gl/GEh1ds
#marshmallow #applinks

entry.title: Android Marshmallow 6.0: Introduction to Doze Mode

media:group.media:title: Android Marshmallow 6.0: Introduction to Doze Mode
media:group.media:description:
Android Marshmallow introduced Doze mode - -a new way for the device to preserve battery by entering into an idle state. This video includes an overview of Doze mode and the motivation behind it, as well as how to make sure that your app behaves as expected both in and out of Doze mode. Most app behavior shouldn’t be affected, but for those special cases, we’ll walk through how to make sure that your app is responsive even during Doze mode, with Google Cloud Messaging’s “high priority” status or with AlarmManager’s new ...AndAllowWhileIdle() methods.
For more Android video content, subscribe to the Android Developers channel here: http://goo.gl/GEh1ds
#marshmallow #doze #appstandby #battery

media:group.media:title: Android Marshmallow 6.0: Data Binding Library
media:group.media:description:
Neto Marin introduces the Data Binding Library. Data Binding Library is a way to write declarative layouts and minimize the glue code necessary to bind your application logic and layouts. The Data Binding Library offers both flexibility and broad compatibility — it's a support library, so you can use it with all Android platform versions back to Android 2.1 (API level 7+).
In this video you will learn how to setup your project to use the Data Binding Library, basic concepts about how to bind data and events, import classes into your layouts, use variables and perform operations to minimize boilerplate code and have a dynamic interface.
For more Android video content, subscribe to the Android Developers channel here: http://goo.gl/GEh1ds
#marshmallow #databinding

media:group.media:title: Android Marshmallow 6.0: Asking For Permission
media:group.media:description:
Nick Butcher explains Android’s runtime permission model and the right way to ask users for permissions. Android 6.0 introduced a brand new runtime permissions model where instead of asking for all permissions at install, app developers control when they’re requested. Picking the right way and time to ask for a permission then becomes critical to it being granted. This video outlines the best ways to ask for permissions in your app.
Runtime permissions let you build a more fluid app experience and enables a streamlined app install & upgrade flow. Understanding when and how to ask for a permission is critical to building better apps.
For more Android video content, subscribe to the Android Developers channel here: http://goo.gl/GEh1ds
#marshmallow #permissions #ux

entry.title: Network Performance 101 (Android Performance Patterns Season 3 ep9)

media:group.media:title: Network Performance 101 (Android Performance Patterns Season 3 ep9)
media:group.media:description:
We live in data-hungry times. Users want more data, more often, and are spending more time searching for it. As a developer of the “next great social application” this might seem like a perfect match for your business plan. But unless you construct your networking requests the right way, your business plan will be a flop.
In this video, Colt McAnlis explains how each individual network request can have a load of performance problems for your users.
Watch more Android Performance Patterns here: http://goo.gl/4ZJkY1
Join the G+ Community here : http://goo.gl/g7mxmI
Subscribe to Android Developers: https://goo.gl/88dzea
#PERFMATTERS

entry.title: AdMob 아이템 판매광고 - 잠재 고객 목록

media:group.media:title: AdMob 아이템 판매광고 - 잠재 고객 목록
media:group.media:description: AdMob의 잠재 고객 목록 기능을 활용하면 원하는 대로 사용자를 타겟팅 하여 사용자별로 가장 알맞은 광고를 노출하고, 여러분의 수익을 최적화할 수 있습니다. 잠재 고객 목록 기능의 역할과 AdMob 사이트와 앱 코드상에서 어떤 단계를 거쳐, 이 기능을 활용할 수 있는지방법을 소개해 드립니다.

media:group.media:title: AdMob 아이템 판매광고 - 시작 하기
media:group.media:description: AdMob 의 새로운 아이템 판매광고 기능을 활용하면 앱의 수익을 최적활 할 수 있습니다. AdMob 아이템 판매 광고가 어떻게 여러분의 수익을 높여 드릴 수 있는지, 그리고 어떤 단계를 통해 이를 적용할 수 있는지, AdMob 사이트 도구를 활용하는 방법과 앱 상에 코드를 적용하는 방법을 소개해 드립니다.

entry.title: Protecting Implicit Intents with Runtime Checks (Android Development Patterns Ep 1)

media:group.media:title: Protecting Implicit Intents with Runtime Checks (Android Development Patterns Ep 1)
media:group.media:description:
Implicit intents (http://developer.android.com/guide/components/intents-filters.html#ExampleSend) could cause an ActivityNotFoundException if there’s no activity to handle the Intent you’ve created, whether it is from the user uninstalling or disabling the other apps, restricted profiles, or device administrator policies. Make sure you protect your implicit intents with a simple runtime check.
Subscribe to the Android Developers channel at http://goo.gl/GEh1ds

entry.title: Android Developer Story: Dots increases installs with Store Listing Experiments

media:group.media:title: Android Developer Story: Dots increases installs with Store Listing Experiments
media:group.media:description:
Dots is a US-founded game developer which released the popular game, Dots, and its addictive sequel, TwoDots. Dots used the Store Listing Experiments feature in the Google Play Developer Console to test what icon, graphics, and text worked the best at converting visitors to installs.
Learn how to use Store Listing Experiments in this DevByte: https://goo.gl/KjzMfD Read the help center article on Store Listing Experiments: https://youtu.be/B6ydLpkhq04 Get more tips to help you succeed on Google Play: https://g.co/play/developers
#android #googleplay #developerstory #featured

entry.title: Location & Battery Drain (Android Performance Patterns Season 3 ep7)

media:group.media:title: Location & Battery Drain (Android Performance Patterns Season 3 ep7)
media:group.media:description:
Location aware Android apps are awesome! Mobile users take their devices with them everywhere, and adding location awareness to your app offers users a more engaging experience.
But as Colt McAnlis shows, all this fancy location data is making your app useful, But if you’re not gathering it in the right way, it can cost you big with respect to battery life.
Watch more Android Performance Patterns here: http://goo.gl/4ZJkY1
Join the G+ Community here : http://goo.gl/g7mxmI
Subscribe to Android Developers: https://goo.gl/88dzea
#PERFMATTERS

entry.title: DO NOT LEAK VIEWS (Android Performance Patterns Season 3 ep6)

media:group.media:title: DO NOT LEAK VIEWS (Android Performance Patterns Season 3 ep6)
media:group.media:description:
As much as we complain about leaking memory, it’s important to know that there some “small” leaks, and some huge, problematic, city-destroying leaks. And in that category sits the ever-so-humble “VIEW” object in your application.
As Colt McAnlis describes, leaking VIEW objects can have massive ramifications to the memory and stability of your application… so.. please.. PLEASE don’t do it…
Watch more Android Performance Patterns here: http://goo.gl/4ZJkY1
Join the G+ Community here : http://goo.gl/g7mxmI
Subscribe to Android Developers: https://goo.gl/88dzea
#PERFMATTERS

entry.title: Domain increases installs by 44% with Material Design and Google Play services

media:group.media:title: Domain increases installs by 44% with Material Design and Google Play services
media:group.media:description:
Learn how Domain, a premier real-estate portal in Australia, drastically improved their Google Play app reviews, ratings and downloads by investing in their Android app experience. The Domain team took advantage of a variety of Google and Android APIs, products and best practices including Material design, Android Wear, Google Maps & Street View, App Indexing, Google Now and more.
Learn more about how Domain found success on Google Play: Material Design guidelines: How Material Design helps you create beautiful, engaging apps. - https://www.google.com/design/spec/material-design/introduction.html
Google Play services: Learn more about Google Play services and the APIs available to you through it.- https://developers.google.com/android/
Find success on Google Play: Products and best practices to help your grow you business globally on Google Play. - http://developers.android.com/distribute
#GooglePlay #AndroidDevStory #PlayStore #MaterialDesign #GooglePlayServices

entry.title: Trimming and Sharing Memory (Android Performance Patterns Season 3 ep5)

media:group.media:title: Trimming and Sharing Memory (Android Performance Patterns Season 3 ep5)
media:group.media:description:
One of the dominant design principles that Android adheres to is that it’s a multitasking operating system: users can have multiple apps running, and can quickly swap between them, as needed.
This means that YOUR application isn’t alone, and it certainly doesn’t own all the available resources on the device. So if you want to play nice with the rest of the system, and NOT be the one kicked out of the sandbox for stealing toys, take the advice of Colt McAnlis and leverage some handy APIs to share memory with your other playmates.
Watch more Android Performance Patterns here: http://goo.gl/4ZJkY1
Join the G+ Community here : http://goo.gl/g7mxmI
Subscribe to Android Developers: https://goo.gl/88dzea
#PERFMATTERS
